conclusion: Particle A and particle B start together at t = 0.
From 0 to t0 both have the same velocity–time line.
From 0 to t0 both particles stay together.
Between t0 and 3 t0 the area under A’s v-t graph exceeds that under B’s.
Between t0 and 3 t0, A moves ahead of B.
From 3 t0 to 5 t0 A’s velocity is smaller than B’s.
From 3 t0 to 5 t0, B closes the gap with A.
The areas between the two curves from 0 to 3 t0 and from 3 t0 onward are equal at t = 5 t0.
Their net displacements from the start are again the same at t = 5 t0.
The two particles meet again at t = 5 t0.
